result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/20/22

9:24 AM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Dennis D Simmons.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney appears by authorization. 
Case called with codefendant, 22CM527.
Both counsel request a joint jury trial date.
State consents to a joint trial.
Jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select 1 alternate juror.  Parties will have a total of 12 strikes.  State will be entitled to 6 strikes.  Each defense counsel will be entitled to 3 strikes.  Parties to premark exhibits.  State to use numbers.  Mr. Baldwin to use A-1, 2, 3, etc.  Mr Simmons to use B-1, 2, 3, etc.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:40 AM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Dennis D Simmons.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense has received discovery and is waiting for an offer.
State will send the offer.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Amended Signature Bond signed by defendant on July 14, 2022.
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with PM Plastics or its employees.  Defendant may have contact with Jimmy A Baldwin in all legal matters but may not discuss this case.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

10:08 AM Defendant Dennis D Simmons in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Klein has just been appointed to this matter.
Defense is waiting for discovery and an offer.
State requests the conditions of bond be modified to allow contact with the co-actor to match the changes in that case.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with PM Plastics or its employees/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.

01:57 PM Defendant Dennis D Simmons in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Taylor Olson.   SPD intern appears as friend of the court. Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in Court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
